倳字的基本解释

倳
zì
树立；建立。
古同“剚”，插入，刺入。

倳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zì］
［《廣韻》側吏切，去志，莊。］
亦作“剚1”。“事2”的被通假字。
(1)刺入；插入。参见“倳刃”、“倳耜”。
(2)通“士”。
(3)通“持”。手执。参见“倳戟”。

倳字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　倳； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页109第12
【廣韻】【集韻】?側吏切，同剚。李奇曰：東方人以物插地中爲倳。【前漢·蒯通傳】通說范陽令徐公曰：慈父孝子，不敢事刃於公之腹者，畏秦法也。【史記·張耳?餘傳】作倳刃。　又立事曰倳。【周禮·天官·大宰】事典以任百官。【註】猶倳也。【音義】猶立也。

考證：〔【廣韻】【集韻】?側吏切，同剚。李奇曰，東方人以物插地皆爲倳。〕　謹照原文地皆改地中。
倳字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
倳字的起名意思

暂无。

Awkward
Basic explanation of words
Awkward
zì
Establish; establish.
Gu Tong "clams", inserts, and pierces.
Awkward
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zì］
["Guangyun" side officials cut, go to Zhi, Zhuang. ]
Also known as "剚1". "Thing 2" was passed falsely.
(1) Penetration; insertion. See "倳逜", "倳耜".
(2) Through "Taxi".
(3) Through "hold". Hand hold. See "Jiji".
Awkward
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset] [Human Character Department] 　倳; Kangxi Strokes: 10; Page Number: Page 109-12
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Side officials cut, the same cut. Li Qi said: Orientals put things in the ground as a guilty one. [Previous Han·Kuitong Biography] It is said that Fan Yangling Xu Gong said: Those who are kind to fathers and filial sons, who dare not do anything in the belly of the public, fear the Qin law. [Historical Records·Zhang Er? Yu Chuan] Make a blade.　I set up the matter again and said 倳. 【Zhou Li·Tian Guan·Da Zai】The ceremonies are used to serve as hundreds of officials. [Note] It's still awkward. [Sound meaning] Still standing. Textual research: [[Guangyun] [Jiyun]? The side officials cut, and the same. Li Qi said that the Orientals always use things to insert themselves into the ground. 〕 　 I would like to change the ground according to the original.
